TextpageLeftNav.bodyText:
Cognitive Services APIsCognitive Services APIs

Provision Windows and Linux virtual machines in seconds

Apply for 1RMB Trial Buy Now

Pricing Details

Face API

The Face API uses an advanced cloud-based face algorithm to detect and recognize faces in images. Related functions include face detection, face verification, and face grouping. Faces can be organized into groups based on the similarity of face images.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.
Tier Feature Pricing
Free version Up to 20 transactions/minute 30,000 free transactions per month
Standard Up to 10 transactions per second
0-1,000,000 transactions ￥ 6.36 per 1,000 transactions new
1,000,001-5,000,000 transactions ￥ 5.09 per 1,000 transactions new
5,000,001–100,000,000 transactions ￥ 3.82 per 1,000 transactions new
More than 100,000,000 transactions ￥2.54 per 1,000 transactions new
Facial recognition storage Maximum 4 MB per image ￥ 1.59 per month per 1,000 images new

Computer Vision API

This state-of-the-art, cloud-based API enables developers to access Premium algorithms that allow for the extraction of rich information from images to classify and process visual data. Features include image analysis, tagging, celebrity recognition, text extraction, and smart thumbnail generation.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.
Tier Feature Pricing
Free version 5,000 free transactions per month
S1 Tagging, facial recognition, getting thumbnail colors and image types 0-1 million transactions - ¥ 6.36 per 1,000 transactions
1 million-5 million transactions - ¥ 5.088 per 1,000 transactions
5 million+ transactions - ¥ 4.134 per 1,000 transactions
S2 OCR (print), adults, celebrities, and landmarks 0-1 million transactions - ¥ 9.54 per 1,000 transactions
1 million-5 million transactions - ¥ 6.36 per 1,000 transactions
5 million+ transactions - ¥ 4.13 per 1,000 transactions
S3 Description and OCR (handwriting) ¥ 15.90 per 1,000 transactions

FAQ

Expand all

Common

  • How are the Cognitive Services APIs billed?

    If Cognitive Services API calls are performed effectively, the Face API, Emotion API, and Computer Vision API are charged per 1,000 transactions.

  • What will happen if I exceed the call limit at the Standard tier?

    If you exceed the quota at the Standard tier, the account starts to add up the excess amount. These excess portions will be billed on a monthly basis at the rate specified for each tier.

  • Can I change the service tier I subscribe to?

    You can upgrade to a higher tier at any time. The billing rate corresponding to the higher tier and the amounts included will take effect immediately.

Face API

  • What is Face Storage? What can it be used for?

    With Face Storage, additional persisted faces can be stored when the Face API is used in conjunction with person objects and FaceLists for identification or similarity matching.

  • If the number of images stored during the month changes, how do you calculate this amount for billing?

    Stored images are charged at ￥ 1.59 per 1,000 faces. This rate is prorated on a daily basis. For example, if your account used 10,000 persisted faces each day during the first half of the month and none during the second half, you would only be billed for the number of days the 10,000 faces were stored for. This would be calculated as (￥ 1.59/1,000) x (10,000 x 15 + 0 x 16)/31 = ￥ 7.69. Alternatively, if you retained 1,000 faces for a few hours each day during a month and then deleted them every night, you would still be billed for the 1,000 faces retained each day.

  • How much capacity does Face Storage have?

    The quota for stored person groups is currently 1,000. Each person group or FaceList can have a maximum of 1,000 people.

Computer Vision API

  • What operations can be completed using the Computer Vision API?

    Tagging - The Computer Vision API returns tags based on more than 2,000 recognizable objects, living beings, types of scenery, and actions. If tags are ambiguous or unusual, the API response will provide “hints” to clarify the meaning of the tag.

    Facial recognition - Detects faces in images.

    Get Thumbnail - Get Thumbnail generates high quality thumbnails after images are uploaded. The Computer Vision API algorithm analyzes objects in images, then crops images according to the requirements for the region of interest (ROI).

    Color - The Computer Vision algorithm extracts colors from an image. The colors are analyzed in three different contexts (foreground, background, and whole). They are grouped into 12 dominant accent colors.

    Image types - The Computer Vision API can set a boolean flag to indicate whether an image is black and white or color. It can use the same method to indicate whether an image is a line drawing. It can also indicate whether an image is clip art, along with its quality.

    OCR - Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology detects text content in an image and extracts the identified text into a machine-readable character stream. You can use the results for searches and numerous other purposes, from medical records to security and banking. It automatically detects the language. OCR saves time and provides convenience for users by allowing them to simply take photos of text instead of transcribing it. Please refer to the Computer Vision Documentation page for supported languages.

    Adult - Apply adult/indecent settings to automatically restrict adult content in images.

    Celebrities - Azure’s celebrity recognition model can recognize 200,000 celebrities from business, politics, sports, and entertainment around the world.

Region

Cognitive Services are available in the following regions:

Territory Region
Mainland China China North, China East

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

We guarantee that Cognitive Services running at the Standard tier will be available at least 99.9% of the time. No SLA is provided for the Free tier. If you want to learn more about the details of our server level agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreement page.

TextpageLeftNav.metaDescription: Learn more about the pricing details for Cognitive Services. Detect the locations of faces in images and compare, group, and identify faces from identities tagged by the user according to their visual similarity.
